definition: battered and exhausted/stuck in a dilemma
wolf/CL:匹[pi3],隻|只[zhi1],條|条[tiao2]
a legendary wolf/distressed/wretched
(negative prefix)/not/no
to endure/may/can

sentences.english: Why did he always think of HIM when he was in discomfiture?
sentences.chinese: 何以他總是在狼狽不堪時想起那個人？

sentences.english: He made an embarrassing gaffe at the convention last weekend.
sentences.chinese: 他在上週末的會議上出了洋相，狼狽不堪。

sentences.english: Bob was in a pickle when his car broke down in a pouring rainstorm.
sentences.chinese: 鮑勃的汽車在傾盆大雨中熄火，使他狼狽不堪。

sentences.english: The battle for your authenticity can be an ugly one.
sentences.chinese: 爲你的真實而戰可能狼狽不堪。

sentences.english: Huang Zhankui back to spike ridge, flustered, they are not.
sentences.chinese: 黃佔魁回到狼牙嶺，狼狽不堪，衆人也是唉聲嘆氣。

sentences.english: For sole sake of rejection, I even run away and battered.
sentences.chinese: 爲了拒絕，甚至讓自己逃跑，顛沛流離，狼狽不堪。

definition: without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
high and mighty (idiom); arrogant
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
to have a lifeless look in one's eyes (idiom)
spitting anger (idiom); in a rage
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
needlework/sewing
out of ammunition and no food left (idiom); in desperate straits
to huddle together/to curl up
masquerade
not to glance sideways (idiom)/to gaze fixedly/to be fully concentrated/to preserve a correct attitude
to follow sb closely (idiom)/to keep close to
